tool.name: Split fastq libraries
tool.description: to performs demultiplexing of Fastq sequence data
tool.command: split_libraries_fastq.py #set $seq_files = '' #set $sep = '' #for $file in $input_fastq_files #set $seq_files += $sep + str($file) #set $sep = ',' #end for -i '$seq_files' -o split_libraries #set $mapping_files = '' #set $sep = '' #for $file in $input_mapping_files #set $mapping_files += $sep + str($file) #set $sep = ',' #end for -m '$mapping_files' #set $barcode_files = '' #set $sep = '' #for $file in $input_files_barcode_read_fps #set $barcode_files += $sep + str($file) #set $sep = ',' #end for -b '$barcode_files' $store_qual_scores #if str($sample_ids): --sample_ids '$sample_ids' #end if '$store_demultiplexed_fastq' '$retain_unassigned_reads' -r '$max_bad_run_length' -p '$min_per_read_length_fraction' -n '$sequence_max_n' -s '$start_seq_id' '$rev_comp_barcode' '$rev_comp_mapping_barcodes' '$rev_comp' -q '$phred_quality_threshold' #if str( $barcode_type.barcode_selector ) != "custom_length" --barcode_type '$barcode_type.barcode_selector' #else --barcode_type '$barcode_type.barcode_length' #end if --max_barcode_errors '$max_barcode_errors' '$phred_offset'

param.name: sample_ids
param.label: Comma-separated list of samples ids to be applied to all sequences (optional)
param.help: It must be one per input file path (used when data is not multiplexed, --sample_ids)

param.name: retain_unassigned_reads
param.label: Retain sequences which donâ€™t map to a barcode in the mapping file?

param.name: max_bad_run_length
param.label: Maximum number of consecutive low quality base calls allowed before truncating a read

param.name: min_per_read_length_fraction
param.label: Minimum number of consecutive high quality base calls to include a read (per single end read) as a fraction of the input read length

param.name: sequence_max_n
param.label: Maximum number of N characters allowed in a sequence to retain it
param.help: This is applied after quality trimming, and is total over combined paired end reads if applicable (-n/--sequence_max_n)

param.name: start_seq_id
param.label: Start seq_ids as ascending integers beginning with start_seq_id

param.name: rev_comp_barcode
param.label: Reverse complement barcode reads before lookup?

param.name: rev_comp_mapping_barcodes
param.label: Reverse complement barcode in mapping before lookup?
param.help: It is useful if barcodes in mapping file are reverse complements of golay codes (--rev_comp_mapping_barcodes)

param.name: rev_comp
param.label: Reverse omplement sequence before writing to output file?

param.name: phred_quality_threshold
param.label: Maximum unacceptable Phred quality score
param.help: E.g., for Q20 and better, 19 must be specified (-q/--phred_quality_threshold)

param.name: max_barcode_errors
param.label: Maximum number of errors in barcode

param.name: phred_offset
param.label: Ascii offset to use when decoding phred scores

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool performs demultiplexing of Fastq sequence data where barcodes and sequences are contained in two separate fastq files (common on Illumina runs).
More information about this tool is available on `QIIME documentation <http://qiime.org/scripts/split_libraries_fastq.html>`_.
